bibl.title: Egypt From Alexander to the Copts. An Archaeological and Historical Guide.
bibl.note: 1 front., tabl., nombr. figg., cartes, plans et pll. n./bl. et coul.

Contributions by 12 authors. - 1. General introduction. - 2. Alexandria, the Delta and northern Sinaï. - 3. The Memphite region. - 4. Christian monasticism and pilgrimage in northern Egypt. - 5. The Fayyum. - 6. Middle Egypt. - 7. The Theban region. - 8. Upper Egypt. - 9. The western oases. - 10. The Eastern Desert. - Chronological outline. Bibliography. Index.
bibl.seg: BAGNALL Roger S. and Dominic W. RATHBONE (Edd.), Egypt From Alexander to the Copts. An Archaeological and Historical Guide.
London, The British Museum Press, 2004, 8°, 319 pp., 1 front., tabl., nombr. figg., cartes, plans et pll. n./bl. et coul. ISBN 0-7141-1952-0. £ 29.95.
